New Records: The 12th team in NBA history to start a season 11-0
Key Match Events: Cleveland Cavaliers rallied for a 105-100 win over the Brooklyn Nets
Darius Garland scored eight of his 20 points in the fourth quarter for Cleveland
Garland put the Cavaliers ahead for good at 97-96 with two free throws
Brooklyn trailed by 15 in the second quarter
Cam Johnson scored 23 points and Dennis Schroder and Cam Thomas had 22 apiece for the Nets
The Cavaliers failed to score 110 points for the first time, ending their NBA-record streak of doing so in 10 consecutive wins to open a season
Post-Match Reflections: Evan Mobley had 23 points and 16 rebounds
The 2015-16 Golden State Warriors hold the league record after winning their first 24 games
They lost to the Cavaliers in the NBA Finals
Hall of Fame centre Wilt Chamberlain and the 1960-61 Philadelphia Warriors had held the mark with nine
Miscellaneous Highlights: Cam Johnson stayed in the game after landing directly on his left hip with 2:44 remaining
The 7-footer was down on the court for a few minutes before being helped to his feet
He was hobbling noticeably in the final minutes
